newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Stora says has lifted fine paper price 8-10 pct.
newsitem.headline: Stora says has lifted fine paper price 8-10 pct.

text.p: Swedish forestry cooperative Stora said on Thursday it has raised fine paper prices by eight to 10 percent since January 1.
"We estimate that we can hold these levels in 1997," Stora Fine Paper's chief analyst Lars Hadders told a forestry seminar in Stockholm.
The price increase related to both uncoated and coated fine paper.
The 1997 price levels are valid on condition that paper manufacturers learn to keep capacity utilisation at a somewhat lower level than they currently do, Hadders said.
Inventory levels are rising slightly at the moment, he added.
Demand for fine paper is expected to be stable in 1997, while output will increase, which in turn will put stronger pressure on mills to reduce utilisation, according to Hadders.
Stora Fine Paper expects to use full capacity during the first quarter, but then to decrease utilisation somewhat during the rest of the year. The unit's delivery time is four weeks.
